# Stationery Backend
## Database Setup (MySQL)
You can run MySQL either locally (Homebrew) or with Docker Compose.
### Option A: Docker Compose (recommended for local dev) ```bash cd backend docker compose up -d ``` This starts MySQL 8 exposed on `localhost:3306` with: - database: `stationery_db` - user: `stationery` - password: `secretpw` - root password: `rootpw`
### Option B: Install MySQL via Homebrew (macOS) ```bash brew install mysql brew services start mysql mysql_secure_installation ``` Then create the database and user: ```sql CREATE DATABASE stationery_db CHARACTER SET utf8mb4 COLLATE utf8mb4_unicode_ci; CREATE USER 'stationery'@'%' IDENTIFIED BY 'SecretP@ssw0rd!'; GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON stationery_db.* TO 'stationery'@'%'; FLUSH PRIVILEGES; ```
### Spring Boot Configuration Example Add (or adjust) `src/main/resources/application.properties`: ``` spring.datasource.url=jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/stationery_db?useSSL=false&allowPublicKeyRetrieval=true&serverTimezone=UTC spring.datasource.username=stationery spring.datasource.password=secretpw spring.datasource.driver-class-name=com.mysql.cj.jdbc.Driver # For dev only; prefer validate or migrations in prod spring.jpa.hibernate.ddl-auto=update spring.jpa.show-sql=true spring.jpa.properties.hibernate.format_sql=true spring.jpa.properties.hibernate.dialect=org.hibernate.dialect.MySQLDialect
# (Optional) Connection pool tuning spring.datasource.hikari.maximum-pool-size=10 spring.datasource.hikari.minimum-idle=2 spring.datasource.hikari.connection-timeout=30000 ```
### Testing the Connection Run the app: ```bash ./mvnw spring-boot:run ``` On startup you should see Hibernate creating or updating tables for entities like `User`, `Item`, `Request`, etc.
### Using Flyway (Optional) Add dependency: ```xml <dependency> <groupId>org.flywaydb</groupId> <artifactId>flyway-core</artifactId> </dependency> ``` Create `src/main/resources/db/migration/V1__init.sql` with initial schema or seed inserts. Set `spring.jpa.hibernate.ddl-auto=validate` afterward.
### Common Issues - Access denied: ensure user/password match and user granted privileges. - Timezone warnings: append `serverTimezone=UTC` in JDBC URL. - Public Key Retrieval error: add `allowPublicKeyRetrieval=true`.
### Switching to H2 for Fast Tests Add dependency: ```xml <dependency> <groupId>com.h2database</groupId> <artifactId>h2</artifactId> <scope>test</scope> </dependency> ``` Then in `application-test.properties`: ``` spring.datasource.url=jdbc:h2:mem:testdb;MODE=MySQL;DB_CLOSE_DELAY=-1 spring.datasource.username=sa spring.datasource.password= spring.jpa.hibernate.ddl-auto=create-drop ``` Run tests with `-Dspring.profiles.active=test`.
### Next Steps 1. Decide migration strategy (Hibernate auto vs Flyway/Liquibase). 2. Add an integration test hitting a repository to verify persistence. 3. Secure credentials using environment variables or a secrets manager for production.
